byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: Russian newspaper Novaya Gazeta publishes document it claims is memo drafted in weeks before collapse of Ukrainian government and presented to presidential administration; document reportedly recommended Russia exploit instability in Ukraine to take control of Crimea and portion of southeastern Ukraine; Russian government calls memo hoax.
lead_paragraph: The Russian newspaper Novaya Gazeta said that a memo, possibly from an oligarch, warned that Moscow should act quickly to protect interests in Ukraine.

headline.main: Early Memo Urged Moscow to Annex Crimea, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Early Memo Urged Moscow to Annex Crimea, Report Says

snippet: The Russian newspaper Novaya Gazeta said that a memo, possibly from an oligarch, warned that Moscow should act quickly to protect interests in Ukraine.
